org.jscsi.parser
Class ProtocolDataUnit

java.lang.Object
  org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit

public final class ProtocolDataUnit
extends java.lang.Object

ProtocolDataUnit

This class encapsulates a Protocol Data Unit (PDU), which is defined in the iSCSI Standard (RFC 3720).

Author:
Volker Wildi

          Default constructor, creates a new, empty ProtcolDataUnit object.

Constructor Detail

ProtocolDataUnit

public ProtocolDataUnit(IDigest initHeaderDigest,
                        IDigest initDataDigest)
Default constructor, creates a new, empty ProtcolDataUnit object.

Parameters:
initHeaderDigest - The instance of the digest to use for the Basic Header Segment protection.
initDataDigest - The instance of the digest to use for the Data Segment protection.
Method Detail

serialize

public final java.nio.ByteBuffer serialize()
                                    throws InternetSCSIException,
                                           java.io.IOException
Serialize all informations of this PDU object to its byte representation.

Returns:
The byte representation of this PDU.
Throws:
InternetSCSIException - If any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

deserialize

public final int deserialize(java.nio.ByteBuffer pdu)
                      throws InternetSCSIException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.security.DigestException
Deserializes (parses) a given byte representation of a PDU to an PDU object.

Parameters:
pdu - The byte representation of an PDU to parse.
Returns:
The number of bytes, which are serialized.
Throws:
InternetSCSIException - If any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
java.security.DigestException - There is a mismatch of the digest.

serializeDataSegment

public final int serializeDataSegment(java.nio.ByteBuffer dst,
                                      int offset)
                               throws InternetSCSIException
Serializes the data segment (binary or key-value pairs) to a destination array, staring from offset to write.

Parameters:
dst - The array to write in.
offset - The start offset to start from in dst.
Returns:
The written length.
Throws:
InternetSCSIException - If any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.

write

public final int write(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel sChannel)
                throws InternetSCSIException,
                       java.io.IOException
Writes this ProtocolDataUnit object to the given SocketChannel.

Parameters:
sChannel - SocketChannel to write to.
Returns:
The number of bytes written, possibly zero.
Throws:
InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

read

public final int read(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel sChannel)
               throws InternetSCSIException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      java.security.DigestException
Reads from the given SocketChannel all the neccassary bytes to fill this PDU.

Parameters:
sChannel - SocketChannel to read from.
Returns:
The number of bytes, possibly zero,or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
java.security.DigestException - if a mismatch of the digest exists.
